intro: Castilleja angustifolia subsp. abbreviata, commonly known as the narrowleaf Indian paintbrush, is a hemiparasitic flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its bright red, orange, or yellow flowers that resemble paintbrushes. The plant has slender, hairy stems and small, narrow leaves that are often reduced or abbreviated, giving it its subspecies name. It typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and sagebrush steppe. Castilleja angustifolia subsp. abbreviata relies on other plants for some of its nutrients, making it an important component of its ecological community.
